title: ‘Will kill you’: Murder convicts tell UP judge after sentencing, say they know where he lives
content: Two men, sentenced to life for a dowry-related murder in Bijnor, issued chilling threats to the judge and the victim's daughter in court.  The convicts vowed revenge, prompting immediate police action to secure the judge's residence and ensure his safety. The murder victim was killed over a dowry dispute involving his daughter.

title: Trump 'bans' Anthropic, gives it same label that China’s Huawei has in US since year 2018
content: Anthropic is locked in a high-stakes standoff with the Trump administration after refusing to give the Pentagon unrestricted access to its Claude AI model. The company drew a line at mass surveillance and autonomous weapons. In response, Trump ordered a government-wide ban on Anthropic's technology, while Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth designated it a "supply chain risk"—a label typically reserved for foreign adversaries.

title: Kejriwal's journey from jail to bail to clean chit: Court says probe agencies not political tools
content: A Delhi court cautioned probe agencies against using investigations to influence political outcomes, stating corruption charges in the liquor policy case lacked sufficient evidence. The judge emphasized that election funding irregularities fall under the Election Commission's purview, not criminal law, unless a distinct criminal offense is proven. This ruling highlights concerns about agencies overstepping their bounds.

title: Court gives clean chit to Ajit and Sunetra Pawar in Maharashtra State Co-operative Bank case
content: A special court has accepted Mumbai Police's closure reports in the Rs 25,000 crore Maharashtra State Co-operative Bank scam, granting a clean chit to Ajit Pawar, Sunetra Pawar, and Rohit Pawar. The Enforcement Directorate's plea to intervene was rejected, with the judge citing a previous similar rejection and an ongoing appeal.

title: 'There will not be a better opportunity': Ashwin urges Samson to go big at T20 WC
content: India dominated Zimbabwe in the T20 World Cup, with openers Sanju Samson and Abhishek Sharma providing a strong start. Samson's quickfire 24 off 15 balls impressed, with Ravichandran Ashwin noting his valuable contribution to the team's momentum. Ashwin also expressed a personal hope for Samson to convert such starts into significant scores throughout the tournament.

title: Why employees of Europe’s biggest software giant are ‘very angry’ with new bonus system
content: SAP faces internal turmoil over a new bonus system favouring underperforming managers over diligent staff. This has sparked team conflicts and questions about fairness amid restructuring.  Employee trust in leadership is reportedly declining, adding pressure as the company navigates AI's impact on enterprise software.

title: US govt seeks delay in tariff refunds as Trump fumes over possible 'rehearing'
content: The Trump administration is requesting a delay in legal proceedings concerning tariff refunds. This comes after the Supreme Court ruled against his global duties. The  US government argues for a "appropriately careful process, not breakneck speed." Earlier, Trump criticised the decision warning of significant payouts and questioned the "possibility of a rehearing."

title: When 16-year-old Shahid Afridi saved Pakistan — Can history repeat in Pallekele?
content: Pakistan's path to the T20 World Cup 2026 semi-finals hinges on a decisive victory against Sri Lanka. Following England's win over New Zealand, Pakistan must secure a substantial margin of victory, either by batting first and winning by 64 runs or chasing a target within 13.1 overs, to surpass New Zealand's net run rate.

title: India vs Pakistan T20 World Cup final loading? Scenario explained
content: Cricket fans might witness another India-Pakistan thriller at the T20 World Cup 2026, but it hinges on several crucial outcomes. While South Africa and England have secured semi-final spots, India needs a win against the West Indies to advance. Pakistan faces a tougher challenge, requiring a massive victory and favorable results to keep their slim qualification hopes alive.

title: Tech startups in US to employees: Leave your shoes behind; reason is said to be China
content: A viral social media post highlights a growing trend in San Francisco's tech scene: a 'no shoes' policy at offices. Startups like Cursor, Replo, and Spur are encouraging employees to shed their footwear, aiming to create a more relaxed, home-like atmosphere.

title: SC raps Bengal for rushing to court daily against SIR
content: The Supreme Court reprimanded the West Bengal government for repeatedly filing vague complaints to delay the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls. The court clarified that while the High Court Chief Justice would decide deployment modalities, judicial officers alone would assess voter claims and document validity, urging the state to cooperate for expeditious completion.

title: 'Cold-blooded murder of democracy': IAS officer suspended for skipping minister’s briefing
content: Maharashtra Pollution Control Board (MPCB) Member Secretary M Devender Singh has been suspended pending disciplinary proceedings. The suspension follows allegations by Environment Minister Pankaja Munde that the IAS officer failed to attend ministerial briefings. BJP MLA Sudhir Mungatiwar strongly condemned the officer's alleged insubordination, calling it a 'murder of democracy'.

title: Amazon CEO does for Sam Altman what Nvidia CEO is having second thoughts on
content: Amazon is injecting $50 billion into AI leader OpenAI, solidifying a strategic partnership. This collaboration will see AWS offer a new 'Stateful Runtime Environment' for generative AI apps, powered by OpenAI models. OpenAI will also leverage AWS's custom Trainium chips, boosting performance and cost-efficiency for their advanced AI workloads.

title: Assam polls: Congress finalises candidates for 40 seats; Gaurav Gogoi likely to contest from Jorhat
content: Congress leader Gaurav Gogoi is reportedly set to contest the upcoming Assam assembly elections from the Jorhat constituency. This move follows the party's finalization of candidates for 40 seats. Gogoi, currently an MP from Jorhat, gained national attention for initiating the no-confidence motion against the Modi government.

title: 'Rare moment': Harvard University apologises over ‘insensitive image’ for Sanskrit course
content: Harvard's South Asian Studies Department apologized for an insensitive social media post featuring artwork for its Sanskrit program. The Coalition of Hindus of North America had accused the university of Hinduphobia. The department expressed regret, committed to teaching Sanskrit, and is reviewing its social media processes to ensure alignment with its values.

title: Rashmika and Vijay’s wedding pic becomes most liked post in Asia
content: Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda's wedding announcement has shattered Instagram records, becoming Asia's most-liked post with over 23 million likes. This monumental achievement has surpassed Virat Kohli's T20 World Cup victory post and other celebrity wedding posts, cementing their place among the all-time most popular Instagram content.

title: 'Faced pressure to arrest Bal Thackeray': Former Maharashtra ATS chief KP Raghuvanshi
content: More than a decade after retiring, former Maharashtra ATS chief K P Raghuvanshi has claimed in his authorised biography that he faced pressure to arrest Bal Thackeray and Indresh Kumar but refused due to lack of evidence. The book links his 2010 transfer to that stance. He retired in 2015 and now serves with Rajasthan Royals.

title: 3 of family including a 9-year-old found dead in Surat flat
content: A man accused of driving a Surat family to suicide has been apprehended in Delhi. Police recovered a suicide note detailing alleged harassment by Vaibhav Rungta, who is accused of financial exploitation and threats against the deceased share trader. The incident tragically claimed the lives of the trader, his wife, and their elder daughter, while their younger daughter survived.

title: 'They have no money, nothing': Trump raises possibility of 'friendly takeover' of Cuba
content: President Trump suggested a "friendly takeover of Cuba," citing discussions with Cuban officials and the island's economic struggles. This follows a confrontation between Cuban forces and a U.S.-registered speedboat, prompting investigations. Trump's administration has intensified pressure on Cuba, impacting its energy supply.

title: HC lifts stay, clears path for ‘Kerala Story 2’ release
content: The Kerala High Court's division bench has lifted a single bench's stay on the release of 'The Kerala Story 2 – Goes Beyond'. The producer argued financial losses, and the court found the initial order lacked sufficient grounds without viewing the entire film. The state is responsible for maintaining public order if issues arise.

title: Matthew Tkachuk calls Edmonton Oilers captain Connor McDavid best player in the world
content: Florida Panthers forward Matthew Tkachuk called Edmonton Oilers captain Connor McDavid the best player in the world after their Olympic gold medal showdown at the Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Games. Tkachuk reflected on a pivotal breakaway save by United States goaltender Connor Hellebuyck that preserved Team USA’s lead and shifted momentum in the championship game.

title: Lauren Kyle shares emotional message after McDavid, Canada’s Olympic loss
content: Connor McDavid’s Olympic run ended in heartbreak as Canada lost 2 to 1 in overtime to the United States in the 2026 Winter Olympics final. Despite dominating play and McDavid earning MVP honors, the result did not favor Canada. His wife, Lauren Kyle, shared an emotional Instagram message expressing pride in his leadership and the team’s effort. McDavid now shifts focus back to the Edmonton Oilers and the NHL season.

title: Is Shai Gilgeous-Alexander on restriction vs Denver Nuggets?
content: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander returns for the Oklahoma City Thunder tonight against the Denver Nuggets after an abdominal strain, though his minutes will likely be monitored. Despite injuries to other key players, the Thunder lead the Western Conference. SGA remains in the MVP race, needing to play in six more games to qualify for postseason honors.

title: ‘Dhurandhar 2’ set for March 19 release, to clash with ‘Toxic’
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar 2' is confirmed for a March 19 release, clashing with Yash's 'Toxic'. Pre-bookings in Australia and France revealed the date and a lengthy 220-minute runtime. Despite trade advice against a clash, both films are set to hit screens, with 'Dhurandhar 2' aiming to replicate its predecessor's massive success. Actress Yami Gautam praised the film as 'beyond extraordinary'.

title: Donald Trump is ‘not exactly happy’ on nuclear talks with Iran
content: President Trump expressed dissatisfaction with ongoing Iran nuclear negotiations, stating Tehran must commit to not developing nuclear weapons. He emphasized the need for a "meaningful" deal, highlighting Iran's past actions and the significant US military presence in the Middle East. Trump indicated a crucial decision lies ahead regarding the diplomatic path.

title: Odisha horror: Woman raped twice in a day, dies after being thrown from 4th floor
content: A 23-year-old woman was allegedly raped and then thrown from the fourth floor of a house in Jagatsinghpur district, leading to her death. Her boyfriend and another man have been arrested in connection with the crime. The woman was reportedly betrayed by her boyfriend before being assaulted by the second accused.

title: Megan Thee Stallion stuns in gold and black look, Klay Thompson reacts
content: Megan Thee Stallion made a striking statement at Milan Fashion Week during an exclusive Roberto Cavalli fitting. The Grammy winner previewed a molten gold gown and a sculptural black dress before stepping out in a bold sheer animal-print look at the Cavalli show. Named a Cavalli Muse, she also prepares for her historic Broadway debut in Moulin Rouge! The Musical this March.

title: 'Time to wear India colours': Omar Abdullah's big backing for J&K cricketers
content: Jammu and Kashmir reached their maiden Ranji Trophy final, a historic achievement celebrated by Chief Minister Omar Abdullah, who believes some players deserve national call-ups. On Day 4, J&K dominated Karnataka, building a commanding 477-run lead and standing on the brink of a historic title win.

title: Gr Noida: Trying to flee, man rams Thar into bike, dragging it for several kms
content: A speeding Thar rammed into a motorcycle and dragged it for kilometres in Greater Noida after the driver allegedly fled a petrol pump without paying. The SUV hit the salesman's bike during a chase, injuring him. Police have taken the accused driver into custody and seized the vehicle.

title: Katara case: SC grants Yadav one-week furlough to spend Holi with family
content: The Supreme Court has granted Vikas Yadav, convicted in the 2002 Nitish Katara murder, furlough until March 7. Having served 23 years of his 25-year sentence, the court permitted his release to spend time during Holi, rejecting objections. This comes after the Delhi High Court had previously denied his furlough plea, citing the gravity of his offenses.

title: Epstein files: Did Ghislaine Maxwell crash Clinton daughter’s wedding? Hillary reveals reason
content: Hillary Clinton testified before the House Oversight Committee regarding her ties to Jeffrey Epstein, stating Ghislaine Maxwell was a guest at her daughter Chelsea's 2010 wedding. Clinton denied any knowledge of Epstein and Maxwell's crimes, asserting she never encountered Epstein or visited his properties.

title: Afghanistan-Pakistan escalation: Why India is keeping a close watch
content: India is closely watching the dangerous escalation between Afghanistan and Pakistan, with Islamabad declaring "open war" after airstrikes. New Delhi views Pakistan's actions as a tactic to mask domestic failures and strongly supports Afghanistan's sovereignty. A regional conflict could derail India's growing development initiatives and investment plans in the country.

title: Anthropic to challenge Pentagon in court, hours after Trump orders ban on AI firm
content: AI firm Anthropic is suing the Pentagon after President Trump ordered a ban on its technology, citing national security risks. Trump labelled the company 'Leftwing nut jobs', accusing them of jeopardizing American lives. Anthropic defends its safeguards against mass surveillance and autonomous weapons, leading to a contract dispute and a split in Silicon Valley.

title: ‘Hungry, tired, incapacitated’: Allahabad HC judge hears 30 cases in 1 day
content: An Allahabad High Court judge reserved a verdict after hearing 30 cases until 7 pm, citing hunger, fatigue, and physical incapacity to dictate the judgment. The judge had a packed schedule with 235 cases listed, but only managed to hear 29 before a Supreme Court-remanded matter extended proceedings significantly.

title: Trump's Truth Social in talks to spin off into publicly traded company
content: Trump Media & Technology Group plans to spin off its Truth Social platform into a separate publicly traded company. This move would separate its social media business from its fusion energy venture, which is merging with TAE Technologies. The company reported a widened net loss in 2025, despite increased financial assets.

title: Yami Gautam says she has watched 'Dhurandhar 2' and people will never forget
content: Following the massive success of 'Dhurandhar', actress Yami Gautam has revealed she has already seen the sequel and is stunned by its quality. She praised director and husband Aditya Dhar's passion and dedication, calling 'Dhurandhar 2' an unforgettable experience that will make every Indian proud.

title: Bengaluru airport chaos: Air India Express flight with 180 passengers stuck for 18 hours
content: Passengers stranded at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport protested after an Air India Express flight to Kathmandu was repeatedly diverted due to bad weather, leaving them waiting for more than 18 hours. About 180 travellers, including a Karnataka tour group, faced inadequate arrangements during diversions to Varanasi and Lucknow. The airline has offered hotel stays and options to reschedule.

title: Jerry sees Cowboys spending more in free agency
content: Cowboys owner and general manager Jerry Jones acknowledged Friday that he has let the fans down with Dallas' championship drought and has promised change -- starting with the team's approach to free agency.

title: Celtics roll behind historic performance from floor
content: The Celtics posted one of the best offensive performances in league history on Friday night against the Nets.

title: U-M secures 1st outright Big Ten crown since' 14
content: No. 3 Michigan defeated No. 10 Illinois 84-70 on Friday night and clinched the Big Ten regular-season title.

title: Miami (Ohio) rallies by WMU late, moves to 29-0
content: Trey Perry scored on a driving layup with a second remaining, and No. 21 Miami of Ohio rallied to beat Western Michigan 69-67 to extend its season-opening winning streak to 29 games.

title: Sources: New WNBPA proposal offers concessions
content: The Women's National Basketball Players Association submitted a new counterproposal to the WNBA on Friday evening with some concessions on revenue share and housing, a source told ESPN on Friday.

title: Cornell stuns Ivy front-runner Yale on last-second 3
content: Jake Fiegen hit a go-ahead 3-pointer with one second left as Cornell upset first-place Yale 72-69 in an Ivy League thriller Friday night.

title: Prochazka, Ulberg to vie for title as Pereira vacates
content: The UFC announced a vacant light heavyweight title bout between Jiri Prochazka and Carlos Ulberg at UFC 327, meaning former champ Alex Pereira has vacated his belt.

title: Ex-pitcher Serafini gets life in prison for murder
content: Former MLB pitcher Daniel Serafini was sentenced Friday to life in prison after being convicted of first-degree murder of his father-in-law, attempted murder of his mother-in-law and first-degree burglary.

title: Preview: Who will book their tickets to WrestleMania 42?
content: Out of the WWE loop? Here's everything you need to know ahead of Saturday's Elimination Chamber in Chicago.

title: Best NFL combine workouts, draft risers: The top performances and prospects from Day 2
content: Day 2 saw speedy defensive backs and a couple of tight ends put on a show. Here are our experts on the combine's top workouts.

title: 'You're looking at a Ferrari': Introducing Konnor Griffin, MLB's next teenage superstar
content: The No. 1 prospect in baseball has a chance to join exclusive company on Opening Day -- if the Pirates are willing to let him.

title: Why the East race is full of high stakes: 'Not a lot of honeymoons going on'
content: Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst survey the league to see who has the edge in the wide-open Eastern Conference.

title: One free agent each NFL team should sign: We found 32 perfect fits
content: Mike Evans to the Bills? Malik Willis to the Jets? Riq Woolen to the Jaguars? We found free agent fits for all 32 teams this offseason.

title: Trade tier rankings: Which big names could bring a Stanley Cup?
content: The playoff races have restarted, with many teams seeking to bolster their rosters for a deep run this spring.

title: Bracketology: UNC inching closer but still outside of top 16
content: The Tar Heels are in third place in the ACC and have won 11 of their past 12 games, but they remain a No. 5 seed.

title: Premier League Power Rankings: Chelsea up, Liverpool down in ratings of all 20 teams
content: ESPN's Premier League Power Rankings return to look at all 20 teams: Chelsea are up, Liverpool are down, and Crystal Palace are on fire.

title: WWE 'SmackDown' results: Logan Paul earns spot in Elimination Chamber match
content: New tag team champions were crowned and a new entrant was added to Elimination Chamber on "SmackDown."

title: NBA awards update: Why Cunningham, Wembanyama are the bets to make for MVP
content: Andre Snellings looks at the NBA awards races and explains which ones to bet on, and which to avoid entirely.

title: Ten years into his UFC career, Brandon Moreno still thinks he can be a three-time champion
content: One more run at the flyweight title would cap an already historic career for Mexican MMA pioneer Brandon Moreno.

title: 'Attempting to mingle': Cameron Brink reveals how she met her fiancé via email
content: Brinks now-fiancé got in contact via unconventional means, eschewing social media direct messages and instead sending an email.

title: Stashing these injured players is a winning move
content: Eric Karabell serves up a list of currently injured players to keep on your radar for the last few rounds of your fantasy drafts.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Randle finishes in top 10, Nembhard in top 50
content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from notable players such as Julius Randle, LaMelo Ball and more.

title: Champions League round of 16 predictions: Real Madrid over Man City?
content: The path to the Champions League final is now mapped out, but who do we think makes it all the way to Budapest? Mark Ogden makes his picks.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal lead Liverpool, Man United for Anthony Gordon
content: Arsenal, Liverpool and Manchester United are set to battle for Anthony Gordon. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: IndyCar 2026: Power's reclamation, Schumacher's rehabilitation, Palou's quest for history
content: Will Power is in new surroundings, Mick Schumacher is stateside, and Álex Palou is chasing history. Here's what to watch in IndyCar in 2026.

title: Man damages Andhra Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan’s convoy cars in Mangalagiri, taken into custody
content: The accused, identified as Narada Neeladri (35) from Kaviti mandal in Srikakulam district, had earlier worked in Chennai and had recently shifted to Vijayawada

title: Muted opening for The Kerala Story 2 despite court clearance
content: Though a Division Bench of the Kerala High Court stayed a single judge’s order halting the release on February 27, the film could initially be screened only in a handful of theatres with limited evening shows

title: Court accepts closure report in Maharashtra State Co-operative Bank case involving Ajit Pawar
content: The court's acceptance of the report came nearly a month after Pawar, then Deputy Chief Minister of Maharashtra, died in a plane crash in Baramati

title: Palayam Imam’s call to open mosques, homes to Pongala devotees goes viral
content: The Imam urged people of Muslim faith to become exemplary hosts to women and children reaching the State capital for the renowned Attukal Pongala festival in a few days from now

title: Maharashtra to vaccinate 9.84 lakh girls aged 14 as part of nationwide HPV vaccination campaign
content: Registration of all beneficiaries for HPV vaccination and distribution of certificates will be done completely digitally through the Central Government’s ‘U-WIN’ portal

title: Passengers protest at Bengaluru airport, as their flight ‘failed to land in Nepal for second day’
content: Protesters claimed they were confined inside the aircraft for more than 30 hours in total and accused the airline of poor coordination and communication

title: U.S. has got measure of 'self-declared Vishwaguru': Congress' dig at PM after Trump's Pak praise
content: "President Trump's full-throated and categorical support for Pakistan in its war with Afghanistan is another setback for Indian 'huglomacy'," says Jairam Ramesh

title: AI Summit Protest: Delhi court grants bail to IYC president Chib
content: On February 24, the court allowed four days of custody to the police to question Mr. Chib over his role in the AI Summit protest held at Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi

title: Four PREPAK (PRO) militants arrested in Manipur
content: Meanwhile, security forces, during an operation at Thinghijang village in Churachandpur district, seized an AK-47 rifle with a magazine, three single-barrel rifles, one bolt-action rifle and one bolt-action sniper rifle with a scope

title: J&K police secure non-bailable warrants against 4 Hizbul ‘commanders’, including chief Salahuddin
content: Officials said Salahuddin is the chief of the so-called United Jihad Council (UJC) and the proscribed terrorist organization Hizbul Mujahideen

title: Watch: Shashi Tharoor: What Kerala can learn from the rest of the world
content: Kerala has historically served as a bridge between the east and the west. It is time we ceased being merely a bridge — and started being the destination. A destination where the best of the world is adapted, improved, and offered back to humanity with a distinctly Malayali touch.

title: The Inverse Law of AI: How capital rises as responsibility falls
content: The recent proceedings in India confirm a quiet but distinct transition: the era of wondering if we should build certain things has been definitively replaced by the race to see how fast we can fund them

title: India and EU to give each other Most Favoured Nation status for 5 years, draft trade deal shows
content: The economic deal between India and EU opens up avenues for India and the EU to stabilise the international order

title: ‘Hidden camera’ found in bathroom of TISS-Guwahati girls’ hostel, probe underway
content: The TISS-Guwahati, in a statement, had said that the recent incident was a “serious privacy violation, and is entirely unacceptable and condemnable”

title: In Friday sermon, Mirwaiz expresses concern over ‘worrying’ situation in Palestine, Iran, Afghanistan
content: He expressed concern over what he described as “breakdown of international law and the moral conscience of the international community” in Palestine.

title: Congress chose appeasement over nation by truncating Vande Mataram, says Haryana CM Saini
content: He was speaking during a debate on the motion of thanks to the Governor’s address in the ongoing budget session of the State Assembly.

title: Surrendered Maoists attend Chhattisgarh Assembly proceedings
content: The group, which included 54 women, spent several hours in the Assembly building where they watched the proceedings and met Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai, Deputy Chief Minister Vijay Sharma and other senior Ministers who hailed the Maoists for their decision to return to the mainstream.

title: Kejriwal’s release exposed high handedness of investigative agencies: Mehbooba Mufti
content: The Awami Ittehad Party (AIP) welcomed the decision of a Delhi court. “The verdict reaffirms faith in the judiciary and the principle that truth ultimately prevails,” said AIP spokesperson Inam Un Nabi.

title: BJP-AGP poll deal likely by March 10: Assam CM Himanta
content: Himanta Biswa Sarma said the parties would go for a friendly contest in seats where they have disputes

title: Odisha police’s final push to bring CPI (Maoist) insurgency to end
content: Security forces have launched operation to nab Sukru, a State Committee Member, who is leading a small group of Left Wing Extremist in Odisha

title: Japan will connect Northeast India to the Bay of Bengal: Dy Foreign Minister Horii Iwao
content: Japan will support connectivity linking Northeast India to the Bay of Bengal and the Indian Ocean. Northeast India is located in a pivotal geopolitical position as a gateway to Southeast Asia, says Horii Iwao

title: District panchayat Budget proposes jobs for 5,000 women
content: Focus on comprehensive development of agricultural sector with an allocation of ₹18 crore; projects in housing and health sectors get ₹18 crore and ₹16 crore respectively

title: A double murder in ‘mini Russia’
content: The killing of two women in January, both named Elena, reopens old questions over foreigners’ deaths in Goa. Sujay Gupta visits Arambol, a fishing village in North Goa, known for playing host to performers, sunset-seeking international travellers, and beach front bars. Running in the background are the stories of victims of alleged murders, whose families from overseas are still fighting for justice

title: Tenth Chiefs’ Conclave bats for future preparedness, wisdom sharing
content: The two-day conclave serves as an institutional platform for professional interaction between the present Army leadership and former Chiefs, fostering continuity and the sharing of collective wisdom across generations

title: As J&K nears Ranji Trophy win, Omar heads to Karnataka to cheer for the home team; BJP and PDP extend support
content: Playing against Karnataka in the summit clash of the nation’s prestigious domestic cricket competition, J&K was in a commanding position on the penultimate day of the five-day contest, securing a 477-run lead at the KSCA Rajnagar Stadium in Hubbali

title: Amit Shah concludes his three-day visit to Bihar’s Seemanchal
content: Mr. Shah directed strict enforcement of a zero-tolerance policy against illegal constructions, particularly in forest and uninhabited areas, and ordered the immediate removal of encroachments identified on No Man’s Land.

title: Kochi Corporation Budget approved amid Opposition boycott
content: For the Budget to be viable, the Corporation must collect property tax worth ₹78 crore in a single month, which is an uphill task, says LDF

title: MCC would be strictly implemented in Tamil Nadu against poll inducements, says CEC Gyanesh Kumar
content: Out of 5.67 crore electors, only 216 appeals have been filed till day, points out CEC; ‘SIR in TN was a model for the country, great success,’ he says

title: Dust, bottlenecks and stench greet Srinivagilu Road commuters as white-topping works drag on
content: Adding to the misery, the Intermediate Ring Road, which runs parallel, is already congested at Sony Signal and the Ejipura Junction, making commuting in the area a Herculean task

title: Food safety officials inspect milk supply chain in SPSR Nellore district
content: After the milk adulteration incident in East Godavari district, officials intensify quality checks at dairies across the district and send samples of milk products to labs for testing

title: Women to move from drudgery to decision-making in agriculture: Union Agriculture Secretary
content: The senior bureaucrat inaugurated businessline’s fifth Agri and Commodity Summit in New Delhi where he spoke about how almost 50% of the rural workforce in the agricultural sector comprises women

title: CPI(M) is fighting both TMC and BJP in West Bengal: M.A. Baby
content: CPI(M) general secretary counters West Bengal Chief Minister’s remarks on a growing CPI(M)-BJP alliance, terming it “ironical”; accuses both BJP and TMC of fuelling communal polarisation

title: Tribal Affairs Ministry set to revamp forest rights cells, form ‘one-stop’ coordinating units
content: Govt. expands mandate of FRA cells to coordinate on all policies; Odisha shuts 50 FRA cells, Chhattisgarh officials say exploring the way forward

title: O. Panneerselvam: A man undone by his own decisions
content: When he joined the DMK in the presence of Chief Minister M.K.Stalin, Mr. Panneerselvam was accompanied by only one legislator, P. Ayyappan. After his expulsion from the AIADMK in July 2022, Mr Panneerselvam had the support of two prominent leaders - R. Vaithilingam and P.H. Manoj Pandian. They joined the DMK recently.

title: PM Modi to launch nationwide HPV vaccination drive on February 28
content: The campaign aims to protect 14-year-old girls across the country from cervical cancer, a disease that remains a significant health concern in India

title: SC Collegium recommends Justice Lisa Gill as Chief Justice of A.P. High Court
content: She enrolled as an advocate in 1990 and practised at the Punjab and Haryana High Court, before being elevated to the Bench of the same court in March 2014

title: Arvind Kejriwal’s court discharge a blow to Union government: Kerala Chief Minister
content: Trial court’s decision not only a setback to BJP but also to Congress that helped the BJP for vested political interests, he says

title: Restoration of Domakonda palace fuels weaving, literature and community life
content: Once filled with debris and snakes, the Domakonda palace complex has been restored into a vibrant cultural hub. Blending architectural conservation, literary heritage and handloom revival, the initiative led by the Kaminenis is rekindling poetry and traditional weaving — breathing new life into a historic village

title: Need to strike a balance, says Supreme Court on SHANTI Act petition
content: Chief Justice of India Surya Kant, heading the Bench, pointed out that bringing nuclear power to India was a necessity to meet the nation’s energy requirements

title: Grey areas persist as key audit gaps surface in Hyderabad Metro Phase‑I buyout
content: With only preliminary audit reports in hand, State government’s proposed ₹15,000-crore takeover of Hyderabad Metro Phase I remains uncertain. Final findings on financial records, technical condition and contractual liabilities will determine the contours of the deal and shape the future of Phase II expansion

title: Kalamassery municipality told to complete biomining at dumping yard in a time-bound manner
content: Once the waste is completely removed and the land levelled, the prime real estate, valued at over ₹50 crore, will be available for various projects of the civic body

title: Didn’t pay influencers to oppose AI Summit, says Congress
content: Congress says the BJP’s allegations that the party paid influencers to malign the AI summit is a ‘fabricated’ story circulated by the BJP’s IT cell

title: ASHA workers protest seeking honorarium hike and halt to retrenchment
content: Leaders of the Karnataka Rajya ASHA Karyakarteyara Sangha says Chief Minister had, during a protest in January 2025, assured them of a minimum monthly guarantee of ₹10,000 and a ₹1,000 hike

title: Karnataka launches action plan on snakebite and rabies; aims to cut snakebite deaths by half, end dog-related rabies deaths by 2030
content: The objective is to ensure that ‘no life is lost due to delay in treatment or lack of access to medicines’, says Minister for Health Dinesh Gundu Rao

title: Apple farmers demand protection against import of fruits from U.S., to hold protest outside Parliament
content: Apple Farmers’ Federation of India will mobilise apple farmers from Jammu & Kashmir, Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand and hold a demonstration outside Parliament in March 2026

title: Bicycle literacy campaign launched in women’s college
content: 22 students, five teachers, and a parent learn to cycle as part of SheCycling’s initiative; next phase from March 5

title: Habitual offender convicted for sexually assaulting 15-year-old boy
content: He had previously served a seven-year prison term for sexually assaulting a mentally challenged woman in 2012

title: Inflexible electricity grids causing ‘dangerous’ situations, says CEA chief
content: Discrepancies forced power producers to undertake ‘curtailment’ where solar and wind power electricity are deliberately switched off from the grid despite producing electricity

title: Singareni likely to explore 19 BCM of coal-bed methane

title: Return Social Science textbook, delete online posts, NCERT tells public
content: NCERT advisory comes a day after Supreme Court banned the Class 8 textbook over a controversial section on ‘corruption in judiciary’; court had also ordered seizure of copies

title: Telangana Chief Minister meets recently surrendered former Maoist leaders
content: Violence cannot provide a lasting solution and that public aspirations can be addressed only through democratic means, Chief Minister told the former CPI (Maoist) leaders

title: An intelligent and non-lethal solution to wildlife threat at ‘Agri Rural Ideathon 2026’
content: ‘Farm Guard,’ as per its creators, is a portable device meant for ‘intelligent and non-lethal deterrence.’ It has been designed keeping in mind farmers in regions prone to human-wildlife conflict

title: Webinar to discuss federalism and the Indian Republic on March 1
content: This session is for students and working professionals who want to deepen their expertise across a range of subjects

title: Chellanam reeling under acute drinking water crisis
content: According to civic representatives, aging pipelines and lack of proper maintenance by the KWA has resulted in the crisis

title: FIR against Mallikarjun Mutya challenged in High Court
content: Mahal Roja Mutt head approaches court seeking to get the FIR registered against him quashed; matter likely to come up on Monday

title: Andhra Pradesh, Telangana plan joint arrangements for Godavari Pushkarams

title: Telangana launches ‘GI on Wheels’ to showcase handicrafts on buses

title: We pass sweeping orders without realising impact on the ground: CJI
content: apex court passes orders unmindful of social ground realities and without understanding their adverse impact on the social fabric . a bunch of petitions challenging the validity of the sedition provision in BNS and a provision in BNSS came up for hearing . senior advocate Menaka Guruswamy said permitting police to conduct preliminary inquiry prior to registration of FIR was in violation of SC ruling in the 2014 lalita Kumari judgment .

title: New GDP series raises growth projection for FY26 to 7.6%
content: Determine the monthly installment amount for a loan Estimate the returns on investments made through SIPs Find out maturity amount and interest earned on PPF Check maturity amount and interest earned on an FD Estimate the pension amount and corpus accumulated under NPS A Mutual Fund Calculator helps estimate the future value of investments

title: Bengaluru-Nepal Air India Express Delayed For 18 Hours, Fliers Raise Slogans
content: Videos from the airport showed the fliers - many of whom were travelling from Karnataka on a planned 10-day Nepal tour - gathering near the immigration area at Terminal 2 and raising slogans against the airline.

title: IAS Officer Suspended After Skipping Meeting Called By Maharashtra Minister
content: The Maharashtra government has suspended an Indian Administrative Service (IAS) officer and the joint director of the state's pollution control body for not attending important meetings to brief a state minister on critical matters.

title: "They Have No Money": Trump Hints At "Friendly Takeover" Of Cuba
content: President Donald Trump said Friday that the US is in talks with Havana and raised the possibility of a "friendly takeover of Cuba" without offering any details on what he meant.

title: Indore University Expels Student From Hostel Over Objectionable Acts In Public
content: A first-year student of Devi Ahilya University in Indore has been expelled from the hostel for allegedly engaging in objectionable activities in front of other girls, an official said.

title: Youth Congress Chief Uday Bhanu Chib Granted Bail In AI Summit Protest Case
content: Indian Youth Congress chief Uday Bhanu Chib was granted bail in the case relating to the shirtless protest at the India AI Impact Summit that was held in the national Capital.

title: "Stop Taking Hostages, Release All Americans": US Puts Iran On New Blacklist
content: The United States on Friday designated Iran a "state sponsor of wrongful detention," its first such move under a new blacklist that could eventually result in a travel ban.

title: DMK, Congress Seat-Sharing Talks To Begin Today Amid Alliance Speculation
content: Ending days of speculation over the future of their alliance, the DMK and the Congress will formally begin seat-sharing negotiations for the upcoming AprilMay Tamil Nadu Assembly elections.

title: Cooperative Bank Case Closure Report Accepted, Ajit Pawar, Others Cleared
content: A court in Mumbai has accepted the closure report given by the police in a case linked to an alleged scam worth Rs 25,000 crore in the Maharashtra State Cooperative Bank (MSCB).

title: 235 Cases Listed, "Hungry, Tired" High Court Judge Reserves Judgment After 29th Hearing
content: A judge of the Allahabad High Court recorded his inability to dictate the verdict in a case after a long day of hearing, saying, "Since I am feeling hungry, tired and physically incapacitated to dictate the judgment, the judgment is reserved."

title: Sam Altman's OpenAI Signs Deal With Pentagon Amid Trump vs Anthropic
content: OpenAI said Friday it struck a deal for the Pentagon to use its models in the US defense agency's classified network, with "safeguards," after President Donald Trump blacklisted AI rival Anthropic.

title: 2 Indian Students Killed In Fire In Their Rented House In London
content: Two Indian students lost their lives in London following a house fire. A third student from the same house was injured and is currently receiving treatment in the hospital.

title: Opinion: Opinion | What's Driving Pakistan-Afghanistan War? Islamabad's Never-Ending Cycle Of Insecurity
content: Islamabad has accused Kabul of drifting into an "India colony", a charge that was further sharpened following Afghan Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi's visit to New Delhi last year

title: Lamborghini Seized In Kanpur Crash Case To Be Released On 8.30 Crores Bond
content: The court had examined a mechanical report from the police and technical experts, following which it ordered the release of the luxury vehicle with conditions.

title: India, EU To Grant Each Other 'Most Favoured Nation' Status. What It Means
content: Neither India nor the EU can extend more favourable tariff concessions to other WTO members without offering the same to each other during the five-year window.

title: Alliances Involving BJP Likely To Be Finalised By March 10 In Assam
content: In an important political development, Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma hinted that the AGP and BJP alliance is likely to be finalised on March 10 for the assembly election.

title: ChatGPT Maker OpenAI Gets $110 Billion Funding From Amazon, SoftBank, Nvidia
content: ChatGPT maker OpenAI has received $110 billion in funding from Amazon, SoftBank and Nvidia, putting the technology company's pre-money valuation at $730 billion.

title: "Won't Do Business With Them Again": Trump's Big Move Against Anthropic
content: President Donald Trump said Friday that he was ordering all federal agencies to stop using Anthropic's technology following the company's unusually public dispute with the Pentagon over artificial intelligence safety.

title: Fino Payments Bank MD Rishi Gupta Arrested For GST Act Violation
content: Fino Payments Bank said that tax authorities have arrested its managing director and CEO Rishi Gupta for violating the law related to the Goods and Services Tax.

title: 'Intimidation Won't Change Our Position': Anthropic Hits Back At Trump
content: President Donald Trump told the US government Friday to "immediately" stop using Anthropic's technology after the AI startup rejected the Pentagon's demand that it agree to unconditional military use of its Claude models.

title: Matt Holliday's Stillwater estate listed for $12 million
content: a Stillwater, Oklahoma, home that once belonged to an MLB champion and seven-time All-Star is on the market at $12 million . the home features sports-related amenities such as a professionally lit baseball field in the front yard, a putting green in the backyard, and a $2 million, two-level swimming pool . indoor batting cages, pickleball and basketball courts reside in a detached $150,000 guest home on the property .

title: The game that will define the 2026 season for every power-conference team
content: the season-defining game will be for all 68 power-conference teams in 2026 . peruse BC's schedule given last year's struggles, and it's tough to find many wins . the Eagles open on the road at Cincinnati, then play FCS Maine .

title: Preview for the 2026 PLL, WLL Championship Series: Key players, schedule, predictions
content: the 2026 PLL and WLL Championship Series runs from Feb. 27 to March 8 . the event uses the Sixes format, which will be used when lacrosse returns to the Olympics in 2028 . it has key differences from outdoor "field" lacross and indoor "box" la crosse .

title: An Ivy League All-American? The next Theo Epstein? Why an ace chose Yale over the SEC
content: OHman was a freshman navigating his first collegiate baseball season . the 6-foot right-hander barely pitched in high school . he admits he considered leaving the Ivy League for a power 4 school, but who would blame him .

title: How the top QB signings will fit in 2026
content: the top 2026 recruits at each position could fit at their new schools . the perfect harmony between skill and scheme can lead to production and wins on the field . this is the most high-profile prospect Houston has signed in the modern era .

title: Power Rankings: Stakes are high for UCLA, two teams rejoin the list
content: the Bruins will be just the fourth program to finish with a perfect regular season in the Big Ten women's college basketball . the last to do it was Maryland in 2015, the season the Terps joined the big Ten and advanced to the final Four for the second year in a row .

title: Preview, key stats to know for ABC Saturday: Penguins-Rangers, Bruins-Flyers
content: the 2026 Olympic men's hockey tournament is complete . the Pittsburgh Penguins face off against the new york Rangers . in the second game, the Boston Bruins take on the Philadelphia Flyers in the playoffs . they will have Rasmus Ristolainen, Dan Vladar and Travis Sanheim .

title: Does anyone beat Ohtani? Buster Olney ranks the top 10 designated hitters
content: coach Buster Olney ranked the best of the best at designated hitters . the goal of this exercise is to identify the best players for the 2026 season, not who might be best in five years or over their career . we rolled out a position per day over two weeks .

title: NHL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, over/under bet for each team
content: the 2026 Olympic ice hockey tournament is complete . all players have returned to their teams, some to the ice, others to injured reserve . a new 1-32 poll is based on the games through Wednesday . it's time to take the temperature with another set of Power Rankings .

title: Wetzel: In search of NFL's fact-finding mission on Giants owner Tisch
content: it has been four weeks since the release of emails between sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein and new york Giants co-owner Steve Tisch . the league will look at all the facts to determine whether a full investigation was in order for potential violations of the league's personal conduct policy . "Absolutely we'll look at the context of those [emails] and try to understand that," Goodell said .

title: ✍️ NFLPA 2026 report cards for all 32 teams
content: ESPN obtained the results of the NFL Players Association's 2026 report cards . it grades franchises from A-plus to F-minus on everything from ownership to treatment of families . all players who were on a 2025 roster at the time of the survey were eligible to participate .

title: 25 surprising stars: Tyler Tanner, Ebuka Okorie, more breakouts
content: the 2025-26 men's college basketball season has been defined by the stars who have turned it into one of the most exciting for the sport in recent memory . the freshman class has an abundance of talent, and there are transfers who have transformed programs, with multiple from either category emerging as household names . we've identified 25 breakout stars to know -- players who have bounced back from injuries .
